content: You are a helpful assistant who is good at identifying named entities and their relations.

Please identify the "['Disease', 'Chemical']" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: The morphological changes of the endothelial cells , which become more pronounced in the later stages of the experiment , the involvement of blood vessels regardless of their diameter and the location - dependent extent of the damage indicate a direct type of damage which is preceded by a mediator - induced increase in permeability , the morphological correlate of which is the formation of gaps in the interendothelial cell connections on the venules .

Let's think step by step.

Step 1: Identify the "Disease" entity.
There is no mention of any specific disease in the paragraph, so there are no disease entities to identify.

Step 2: Identify the "Chemical" entity.
There is no mention of any specific chemical in the paragraph, so there are no chemical entities to identify.
Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to any of "['Disease', 'Chemical']"

The morphological changes of the endothelial cells, which become more pronounced in the later stages of the experiment, the involvement of blood vessels regardless of their diameter and the location-dependent extent of the damage indicate a direct type of damage which is preceded by a mediator-induced increase in permeability, the morphological correlate of which is the formation of gaps in the interendothelial cell connections on the venules.
Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with columns ["Entity", "Entity Type"]. Make sure the Entity Types are in ['Disease', 'Chemical'].
